    • Method Detail

      • forNestedName

        public static Class<?> forNestedName(String className,
                                     Object enclosingInstance)
        Returns the Class object associated with the bested class with the given short string name.

        For example, the following code fragment returns the runtime Class descriptor for the class named java.java.util.ArrayList$SubList:

        Class t = Class.forNestedName("SubList", new ArrayList<>())
        Parameters:
        className - the short name of the desired static or non-static nested class.
        enclosingInstance - the instance of the enclosing class.
        Returns:
        the Class object for the class with the specified name.

      • getEnclosingInstance

        public static Object getEnclosingInstance(Class<?> clazz,
                                          Object[] parameter,
                                          Class<?>[] parameterTypes)
        Helper method, that returns an instance for the given Class
        Parameters:
        clazz - the Class Object
        parameter - the parameters for the given Class i.e. new Object({"Hello World", 1})
        parameterTypes - the parameter types i.e. new Object({String.class, int.class})
        Returns:
        the instance of Object
        Throws:
        PrivateConstructorTesterException - if this Constructor object is enforcing Java language access control and the underlying constructor is inaccessible. if the number of actual and formal parameters differ; if an unwrapping conversion for primitive arguments fails; or if, after possible unwrapping, a parameter value cannot be converted to the corresponding formal parameter type by a method invocation conversion; if this constructor pertains to an enum type. if the class that declares the underlying constructor represents an abstract class. if the underlying constructor throws an exception.
